column2: KY DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column6: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.
column8: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
3. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 4. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
5. This road sign means:
6. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column8: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 7. When entering an expressway from the entrance ramp, you should:
column4: go down to the bottom of the ramp and stop until it is safe to enter the expressway.
column6: cross over to the traffic lane as soon as possible.
column8: use the acceleration lane to blend into the traffic.

column2: 8. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column6: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.
column8: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.

column2: 9. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 10. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column6: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 11. As the percentage of alcohol in your blood (BAC) increases, you become:
12. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.

column2: 13. What does this sign indicate?
14. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.

column2: 15. This sign indicates:
16. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 17. Which shape is a yield sign?
18. Regulatory signs are:
19. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 20. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column6: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column8: watch for children and be ready to stop.

column2: 21. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
22. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.
column6: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.
column8: it draws the attention of other drivers.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 24. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
column6: help create a safe driving environment.

column2: 25. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.

column2: 26. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 27. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 28. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 29. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
30. When passing a vehicle,  it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you look over your shoulder and see no vehicle behind you.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: the driver you just passed signals you over.

column2: 31. This sign means:
32. When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
column4: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.
column6: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.
column8: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.

column2: 33. The first thing affected after drinking alcohol is:
34. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
35. Your BAC depends on:
column6: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 36. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn the front wheels:
37. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 38. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
40. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
